question.text: In majority of nephrons in humans, the loop of Henle is

options.text: too short and extends only very little into the cortex.
too long and extends very deep into the cortex.
too short and extends only very little into the medulla.
too long and extends very deep into the medulla.

solution.text: The nephron is the structural and functional unit of the kidney. Each nephron consists of a glomerulus and the renal tubule. Renal tubule consists of Bowman's capsule and PCT, DCT and Henle's loop. Based on the length of the loop of Henle, two types of nephrons are seen, cortical and juxta-medullary nephrons. Cortical nephrons have a short loop of Henle as it extends in the cortex only and the majority of nephrons are of this type. This type of nephron is mainly responsible for excretion function. Juxta medullary nephrons have a long loop and extend in the medulla. This is primarily responsible for the concentration of urine so that water loss is prevented.
